relation: Pitt Rivers Museum Advice for art teachers on what to do before, during and after a visit.
Pitt Rivers Museum A single folded activity sheet for KS3 artists, designed to support a general visit. The ideas are easily adapted to other museum visits.
University Museum of Natural History and the Museum of the History of Science This resource supports a twin museum visit for KS3/4 pupils
Pitt Rivers Museum Exploring some ways in which different cultures have modified and decorated the body. The pack includes example sketchbook, map, introduction and contextual information sheets.
Oxford University Museum of Natural History The pack includes example sketchbook, map, introduction and information sheets.
Pitt Rivers Museum This pack includes links to websites featuring contemporary Haida artists.
Museum of the History of Science Exploring different ways in which cultures have marked the passage of time.
Pitt Rivers Museum The pack includes example sketchbook, map, introduction and information sheets.
Museum of the History of Science Looking at unusual scientific novelties collected by early natural scientists.
The Ashmolean Introducing some portraits from the Ashmolean Museum collection. The pack includes an example sketchbook, notes and an activity sheet.
Pitt Rivers Museum Exploring the Museum's wide collection of pots. The pack includes sketchbook, map, introduction and information sheets.
Museum of Natural History A workbook comprising a trail, an example sketchbook and notes for annotation on the theme of skeletons.
Pitt Rivers Museum A Museum map showing key objects, contextual information and an example sketchbook page based around the Museum's collection of arms and armour.
pageTitle: Art Resource Packs | University of Oxford Museums and Collections
textBeforeTable: The Pitt Rivers Museum Art Handbook (link opens in new window) also makes great suggestions for using the museum as an art resource for secondary and post-16 students, which applies well to all of our museums. Click on the images below to download resource packs for art students and teachers on a variety of themes. They  offer teachers' notes, contextual information to help students annotate their sketchbooks, a map of key objects, and a sketchbook page showing what can be achieved from a Museum visit.
